item.title: Maggie add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Maggie add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Maggie add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "If you care about something you have to protect it – If you’re lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it." -- John Irving

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "When I go around and speak on campuses, I still don't get young men standing up and saying, How can I combine career and family?" -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "Seize the moment. Remember all those women on the 'Titanic' who waved off the dessert cart." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Maggie add a quote by John Stuart Mill
item.description: "Bad men need nothing more to compass their ends, than that good men should look on and do nothing." -- John Stuart Mill

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mel Brooks
item.description: "Look, I really don't want to wax philosophic, but I will say that if you're alive, you've got to flap your arms and legs, you got to jump around a lot, you got to make a lot of noise, because life is the very opposite of death. And therefore, as I see it, if you're quiet, you're not living. You've got to be noisy, or at least your thoughts should be noisy, colorful and lively." -- Mel Brooks

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Get busy living or get busy dying." -- Stephen King

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Maggie add a quote by H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
item.description: "Approach love and cooking with reckless abandon" -- H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "When you learn, teach, when you get, give." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "I have not ceased being fearful, but I have ceased to let fear control me." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Elizabeth Cady Stanton
item.description: "Come, come, my conservative friend, wipe the dew off your spectacles, and see that the world is moving." -- Elizabeth Cady Stanton

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Adam Lindsay Gordon
item.description: "Life is mostly froth and bubble, Two things stand like stone. Kindness in another's trouble, Courage in your own." -- Adam Lindsay Gordon

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Somerset Maugham
item.description: "The only important thing in a book is the meaning that it has for you." -- Somerset Maugham

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "This is my simple religion. No need for temples. No need for complicated philosophy. Your own mind, your own heart is the temple. Your philosophy is simple kindness." -- Dalai Lama XIV
